content.description: The falcon guide describes this route as looking really good but needing one more bolt. I don't remember it matching that description exactly... Not sure. Top rope it and see what u think.
content.location: Farthest route left on the wall.

content.description: Black rock and lots of interesting fossils.
More black rock with lots of fossils...

This is the warm up climb for the last section of the Bright Angel Walls.  As the Falcon Guide says, "(It is) way easier than it looks."  Face climb a fossil covered section of the cliff past two bolts.  Move left at the top past a right angling crack and top out at the tree.
content.protection: Two Bolts.  No Gear.  Sling a tree for the top anchor.
content.location: Down climb the gully that leads to the climbs at the Crumblin Wall.  Billy Crystal is the first climb encountered.  Start below the dead tree at about head high.

content.description: A section of cliff jJust past the Lower Flailing Walls. The information on this wall is found in Green's Falcon Guide. Godliness and Cleanliness are interesting fossil routes that are very moderate with only a couple of bolts for pro. The rock is good. I found these routes to be best used as top ropes for beginners. I top roped Loch Ness years ago and found the rock less than good and fairly uninteresting. I haven't touched it since. Perhaps another look from someone else might yield different results. There is a bolted anchor at the top of this cliff that can provide access to all three climbs. Directionals up high are advised if you can find places for pro. Not the best section of cliff for this area, but it's there.
